Description: Rim and body sherd of South Ionian pottery little master cup; glaze fired light ornga-brown; interior: on rim, nine dilute lines between glaze bands; wall glazed; top of rim glazed; exterior: laural leaf pattern band on lip; handle zone reserved, glazed below; inscription on exterior.
Type series: Schlotzhauer little master Ionian Cup type
Curator's comments: Schlotzhauer identifies the sherd a belonging to his group of South Ionian little master cups and South Ionian cups with everted rim Type 9B. However, the carination at the rim and body is consistent with his Type 9.C. The type finds parallels with the shape of Attic Little Master lip cups. These cups coincide with Hayes’ Ionian Cup Type XI (Boardman and Hayes 1966, 111-116). Type 9 cups have been found in large numbers in other sanctuary settings including at the Sanctuary of Aphrodite at Miletus, the Sanctuary of Demeter and Kore at Tocra, and at the site of Megara Hyblaea on Sicily. This type was the most common type of South Ionian cups with everted rims found at Naukratis. The Type 9 shape evolved from the earlier Type 5 cup shape.
Bibliographic references: Schlotzhauer 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus Naukratis (p. 52, no. 292)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.772) (Phase 3)
